body:
Would it make sense to put the options files in the same directory as the
tests?

On Wed, Feb 22, 2017, 3:54 PM matt-kwong <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> The test SSL data is now embedded into ssl_server_fuzzer.c when compiled.
> Also, by request of oss-fuzz, moving fuzzer options out of their repo into
> ours.
> ------------------------------
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
>
>   https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835
> Commit Summary
>
>    - Change ssl_server_fuzzer.c to use ssl_test_data.h instead of loading
>    mock SSL data from file
>    - Add fuzzer options for oss-fuzz
>
> File Changes
>
>    - *M* test/core/security/BUILD

>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-1> (14)
>    - *A* tools/fuzzer/options/api_fuzzer.options
>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-2> (3)

>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-6> (2)
>    - *A* tools/fuzzer/options/hpack_parser_fuzzer_test.options
>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-7> (3)
>    - *A* tools/fuzzer/options/percent_decode_fuzzer.options
>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-8> (2)
>    - *A* tools/fuzzer/options/percent_encode_fuzzer.options
>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-9> (2)

>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9835/files#diff-10> (3)

> â€”

>

That's certainly an option. I prefer keeping them separate because it's convenient to keep them all in the same folder since they need to be moved into a different directory for the oss-fuzz build process. Also, they have nothing to do with our own running of the fuzzer tests, so it might add bloat/confusion to our repo, but I'm willing to move them to the fuzzers' directories for other reasons.

So there's good news and bad news.

:thumbsup: The good news is that everyone that needs to sign a CLA (the pull request submitter and all commit authors) have done so.  Everything is all good there.

:confused: The bad news is that it appears that one or more commits were authored by someone other than the pull request submitter.  We need to confirm that they're okay with their commits being contributed to this project.  Please have them confirm that here in the pull request.

*Note to project maintainer: This is a terminal state, meaning the `cla/google` commit status will not change from this state. It's up to you to confirm consent of the commit author(s) and merge this pull request when appropriate.*

<!-- need_author_consent -->
Remaking a new PR since things got butchered. Sorry for the noise everyone
